repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Closes #3583 

The major things mentioned in that issue have been documented. I went through the 3.0 release notes and added a few more doc changes that seemed appropriate. As long as I was there I turned the PEP and github issue mentions into links. I can revert this if it seems too much.

There are many warnings when building docs.  I quieted some of the easiest ones:
- added the index for docs/reference and the contributing page to the front index to make them more prominent and quiet some warnings about "page not included in TOC"
- added `:orphan:` to some pages that are used as historical reference to quiet warnings about "page not included in TOC".

Fixing others warnings is more invasive so will need another PR

comment_data.body: This page is linked via the top navbar so it does not need to be included in a TOC
This was the only real fix for new features: adding the new parameter to the "help"
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -948,6 +948,11 @@ def cythonize(module_list, exclude=None, nthreads=0, aliases=None, quiet=False,
                      See examples in :ref:`determining_where_to_add_types` or
                      :ref:`primes`.
 
+
+    :param annotate-fullc: If ``True`` will produce a colorized HTML version of
+                           the source which includes entire generated C/C++-code.
+
+

comment_data.body:
Why aren't these at the end of the file as well?

On a related note – I'm not sure if I really want to maintain this list whenever I add an entry. Including merge conflicts and all that. The linking seems like something that a Sphinx plugin should do for me.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -133,43 +146,56 @@ Other changes
   homeless builtins, to help with debugging, and in order to avoid a CPython
   warning according to https://bugs.python.org/issue20204
 
+.. _2056: https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2056
+.. _3090: https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3090
+.. _2227: https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2227

comment_data.body: If any, then all versions should have an anchor like this. Again, might be something that Sphinx could do.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -498,39 +524,139 @@ Other changes
   but with ``str`` literals (also in Python 2.7).  This is a backwards incompatible
   change from the previous default of Python 2 semantics.  The previous behaviour
   is available through the directive ``language_level=2``.
-  (Github issue #2565)
+  (Github issue 2565_)
 
 * Cython no longer generates ``__qualname__`` attributes for classes in Python
   2.x since they are problematic there and not correctly maintained for subclasses.
-  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue #2772)
+  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue 2772_)
 
 * Source file fingerprinting now uses SHA-1 instead of MD5 since the latter
   tends to be slower and less widely supported these days.
-  (Github issue #2790)
+  (Github issue 2790_)
 
 * The long deprecated include files ``python_*``, ``stdio``, ``stdlib`` and
   ``stl`` in ``Cython/Includes/Deprecated/`` were removed.  Use the ``libc.*``
   and ``cpython.*`` pxd modules instead.
-  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue #2904)
+  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue 2904_)
 
 * The search order for include files was changed. Previously it was
   ``include_directories``, ``Cython/Includes``, ``sys.path``. Now it is
   ``include_directories``, ``sys.path``, ``Cython/Includes``. This was done to
   allow third-party ``*.pxd`` files to override the ones in Cython.
-  Patch by Matti Picus.  (Github issue #2905)
+  Patch by Matti Picus.  (Github issue 2905_)
 
 * The command line parser was rewritten and modernised using ``argparse``.
-  Patch by Egor Dranischnikow.  (Github issue #2952, #3001)
+  Patch by Egor Dranischnikow.  (Github issue 2952_, 3001_)
 
 * Dotted filenames for qualified module names (``pkg.mod.pyx``) are deprecated.
   Use the normal Python package directory layout instead.
-  (Github issue #2686)
+  (Github issue 2686_)
 
 * Binary Linux wheels now follow the manylinux2010 standard.
-  Patch by Alexey Stepanov.  (Github issue #3355)
+  Patch by Alexey Stepanov.  (Github issue 3355_)
 
 * Support for Python 2.6 was removed.

comment_data.body:
> The linking seems like something that a Sphinx plugin should do for me.

There is [sphinx-issues](https://github.com/sloria/sphinx-issues), I will add it to the doc build. Then using `:issue:`3736` should automatically link to the issue.

comment_data.body: hmm, where *is* the doc build? I can't find a CI run that builds the docs. Does the readthe docs "advanced configuration" specify a `requirements.txt` ? (It should be at https://readthedocs.org/dashboard/cython/advanced/)?

comment_data.body: I dropped the anchors and the references. It is not worth the effort to mess with this: sphinx does not do a good job creating anchors with only digits, periods, spaces, and parentheses.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -498,39 +524,139 @@ Other changes
   but with ``str`` literals (also in Python 2.7).  This is a backwards incompatible
   change from the previous default of Python 2 semantics.  The previous behaviour
   is available through the directive ``language_level=2``.
-  (Github issue #2565)
+  (Github issue 2565_)
 
 * Cython no longer generates ``__qualname__`` attributes for classes in Python
   2.x since they are problematic there and not correctly maintained for subclasses.
-  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue #2772)
+  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue 2772_)
 
 * Source file fingerprinting now uses SHA-1 instead of MD5 since the latter
   tends to be slower and less widely supported these days.
-  (Github issue #2790)
+  (Github issue 2790_)
 
 * The long deprecated include files ``python_*``, ``stdio``, ``stdlib`` and
   ``stl`` in ``Cython/Includes/Deprecated/`` were removed.  Use the ``libc.*``
   and ``cpython.*`` pxd modules instead.
-  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue #2904)
+  Patch by Jeroen Demeyer.  (Github issue 2904_)
 
 * The search order for include files was changed. Previously it was
   ``include_directories``, ``Cython/Includes``, ``sys.path``. Now it is
   ``include_directories``, ``sys.path``, ``Cython/Includes``. This was done to
   allow third-party ``*.pxd`` files to override the ones in Cython.
-  Patch by Matti Picus.  (Github issue #2905)
+  Patch by Matti Picus.  (Github issue 2905_)
 
 * The command line parser was rewritten and modernised using ``argparse``.
-  Patch by Egor Dranischnikow.  (Github issue #2952, #3001)
+  Patch by Egor Dranischnikow.  (Github issue 2952_, 3001_)
 
 * Dotted filenames for qualified module names (``pkg.mod.pyx``) are deprecated.
   Use the normal Python package directory layout instead.
-  (Github issue #2686)
+  (Github issue 2686_)
 
 * Binary Linux wheels now follow the manylinux2010 standard.
-  Patch by Alexey Stepanov.  (Github issue #3355)
+  Patch by Alexey Stepanov.  (Github issue 3355_)
 
 * Support for Python 2.6 was removed.

comment_data.body:
These are leftovers then, right?

> where is the doc build

It's probably set up somewhat manually on readthedocs. @robertwb originally created it.

commit.message: DOC: make some github issues into links, doc fixes
add a doc_requirements.txt for building docs

verification.payload:
tree e004f24fd225f76fdf1187ee2cc300d3ed2519d6
parent c6c623486edc8aa7c15b0234bec21c0e7f41695b
author scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de> 1617397047 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1617397047 +0200

Rename doc_requirements.txt to doc-requirements.txt

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: DOC: make some github issues into links, doc fixes
